conditions.today: 6 AM—Friday is here, Jackson! Why not start the weekend a little early and spend the day in a sugar-frosted wonderland? 2 inches of sweet crystals fell in dribs and drabs over the past 24 hours, sprinkling a few fresh flakes for flashing across the slopes. Sunshine and clouds will dance slowly through the sky, blown by the rhythm of southwest winds in the zip to 15 mph range. Higher gusts will likely hit the upper elevations this afternoon as they shift more out of the west. Bundle up because cool temperatures will stall out in the single digits at the summit and in the low 20s down in the base zone. Escape the humdrum by getting off the endlessly spinning corporate hamster wheel. You might lose income, but Rendezvous Mountains' reimbursement is far more real. -Lege
conditions.yesterday: 6 AM—Greetings, Jackson Hole. Pop outta that bed and come enjoy the lingering effects of yesterday's fantastic storm. 6" fell on Rendezvous Mountain over the past 24 hours, with 1 of those settling after the lifts closed. Scattershot snow showers will continue to put the finishing touches on the storm total through the morning hours before giving way to some infiltrating sunbeams this afternoon. You might want to stop in to Corbet's Cabin for a warm waffle, because powder-preserving temperatures are going to top out in the single digits at the summit and in the low 20s down in Teton Village. Light to moderate west-southwest winds will keep your vapor trails swirling as they clock in between 5 and 25 mph. Don't feel like your exuberance is something to conceal when so many snowy treasures abound. The elevated euphoria is real, so give a shout and let the universe know every time another one is found. -Lege

trends: Great week for snow - 24" in last 7 days
recommendations: Fresh corduroy on Hanging Rock - perfect for intermediate skiers
Fresh corduroy on Bivouac - challenging for advanced skiers
Fresh corduroy on Teewinot (Upper) - perfect for intermediate skiers

morningBrief.headline: 2" Freshened Things Up
morningBrief.body: The mountain got a nice 2" touch-up. Expect improved conditions. 8 runs freshly groomed, mostly in All Terrain.
